required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of Toronto Association in the Treatment of Erectile Dysfunction and Premature Ejaculation
clinical_study.official_title: National, Multicenter, Randomized, Double-blind, Double-dummy, Phase III Clinical Trial to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Toronto Association in the Treatment of Erectile Dysfunction and Premature Ejaculation

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of Toronto association in the treatment of both sexual dysfunction: erectile dysfunction and premature ejaculation.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of participants with treatment response after 4 weeks of treatment.
primary_outcome.description: The treatment response will be based on the participant's questionnaire answer after the treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of participants with treatment response after 8 weeks of treatment.
primary_outcome.description: The treatment response will be based on the participant's questionnaire answer after the treatment.

secondary_outcome.description: Incidence and severity of adverse events recorded during the study.

intervention.description: Toronto association coated tablet, 20 mg + 30 mg or 20 mg + 60 mg, oral, 2 hours before the sexual intercourse.
Tadalafil coated tablet, 20 mg, oral, 2 hours before the sexual intercourse.
Tadalafil placebo coated tablet, oral, 2 hours before the sexual intercourse.
Toronto association placebo coated tablet, oral, 2 hours before the sexual intercourse.
